metadata.title: Govt launches bold institutional reforms to inspire future generations: Minister

content.article_body: ISLAMABAD, Oct 09 (APP):Federal Minister for Overseas Pakistanis and Human Resource Development, Chaudhry Salik Hussain, stated that the government is implementing groundbreaking reforms across its institutions, aiming to set a lasting example and inspire future generations. He expressed these views while addressing the oath-taking ceremony of award-winning students at PBF International College, Islamabad. Secretary Workers Welfare Fund, Zulfiqar Ahmed, and Director General Radio Pakistan, Saeed Ahmed Sheikh, were also present on the occasion. Speaking at the ceremony, the minister said that the Ministry of Overseas Pakistanis and Human Resource Development is setting new benchmarks across all its affiliated institutions - benchmarks that will inspire others to follow. Chaudhry Salik Hussain emphasized that the nation's hopes rest upon its youth, whose hard work, honesty, and character will shape the country's future. He lauded the Workers Welfare Fund and its Secretary for playing a key role in promoting education and providing high-quality learning facilities to the children of the working class. He said that through the efforts of the Workers Welfare Fund, students have excelled not only at the national level but have also brought honor to Pakistan internationally. Highlighting the importance of holistic education, Chaudhry Salik Hussain stated that it is essential to nurture a generation capable of competing globally. He added that education is not limited to textbooks, but also instills awareness, tolerance, and human values. The minister further said that it is imperative to focus on the moral and ethical development of the youth alongside their academic growth, so that they consider serving the nation as their life's purpose. Salik Hussain paid tribute to PBF College Principal Sarah Mohsin, the teachers, parents, and the administration for their dedicated efforts, and prayed for Pakistan's progress, stability, and prosperity. Earlier, the minister also planted a sapling at the college premises.
